column2: Midwest, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Began w/20mgs. 5/1, resulting in dizziness, cough, dis-orientation, irregular heartbeat, weakness--wanted to sleep--hard to work a full day in my job.  After 6 days of taking this, I ended up at ER with monitors, x-rays, blood tests, EKG, etc.  Drs. said "everything fine"  Frightening.  I cut dosage down to 10mgs. Still having irregular hard beats, dry cough, runny nose and being tired.  I Take no other meds at all.  This is not working for me after taking it regularly for 23 days.  I take it at night, and it is very hard to sleep since apparently, it makes my heart beat so irregular.  Will ask Dr. to change medication.  The worry I go through is far worse than having high B/P.  It is good that it helps some people.  Just because it doesn't seem to work for me in the short-term, doesnt mean that it won't help others. I guess we all have a different chemistry...I know a person should not just stop taking a medication without consulting a Dr., but I will be discontinuing taking this as of today...

column9: I started this med over 5 years ago, 10mg with HCTZ and had a difficult time getting adjusted to it...dizzy on standing, light headed, loss of libido. All during the time on benazepril, I've had a persistant cough I attributed to post nasal drip/allergies...bronchitis 2x past winter.  I've had swollen ankles for over two months, nausea/GERD that requires Prevacid for over 1 year, swollen eyelids for few weeks until one swelled shut.  Dr wants me to take Diovan (can't take calcium channel or BETA blockers for the severe side effects).  I think I will try the exercise and life style changes and monitor bp before I start the new meds.
